keyMoments.title: Nearly Executed by Kizaru
keyMoments.description: Zoro, already severely injured and unable to move, is pinned down by Admiral Kizaru who prepares to execute him with a light kick. Usopp and Brook desperately try to save him but fail.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates how helpless the Straw Hats are against Admiral-level threats. Zoro, typically one of the crew's strongest fighters, is completely at Kizaru's mercy.

keyMoments.title: Saved by Rayleigh's Intervention
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh appears at the last moment and kicks away Kizaru's light attack, saving Zoro's life.
keyMoments.significance: Rayleigh's intervention prevents Zoro's death and marks a turning point in the episode.

keyMoments.title: Disappears via Kuma's Power
keyMoments.description: Bartholomew Kuma approaches Zoro, asks him about vacation destinations, then slaps him with his paw-padded hand, causing Zoro to completely vanish in a bubble-like effect.
keyMoments.significance: This is the beginning of the crew's forced separation. Zoro becomes the first Straw Hat to disappear, traumatizing the crew and marking a major turning point in the series. He won't be seen again until after the time skip.

keyMoments.title: Orders Crew to Retreat
keyMoments.description: Recognizing the impossible situation, Luffy makes the painful decision to order his crew to run away for the first time, showing growth as a captain who must prioritize survival over pride.
keyMoments.significance: A watershed moment for Luffy's character development. Ordering a retreat goes against his nature but demonstrates his maturity and responsibility as captain.
keyMoments.quote: Everyone, run! We can't win this fight!

keyMoments.title: Battles Sentomaru
keyMoments.description: Luffy fights Sentomaru who uses Ashigara Dokoi to send him flying despite his rubber body.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even Luffy cannot overcome the enemies they face, foreshadowing the crew's defeat.

keyMoments.title: Witnesses Zoro's Disappearance
keyMoments.description: Luffy watches in horror as Bartholomew Kuma makes Zoro vanish, screaming his name in absolute devastation.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most emotionally devastating moments for Luffy as captain, unable to protect his crew member.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Dramatic Entrance - Blocks Kizaru's Attack
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh appears out of nowhere and kicks away Kizaru's light beam, saving Zoro from execution. He then confronts the Admiral directly.
keyMoments.significance: One of the most iconic moments in Sabaody. Rayleigh demonstrates his incredible speed and power by matching an Admiral's attack.
keyMoments.quote: Don't you think it's too early for them to head to the New World?

keyMoments.title: Battles Admiral Kizaru
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh engages Kizaru in direct combat, intercepting his Yata no Kagami technique and clashing swords with the Admiral's Ama no Murakumo light sword.
keyMoments.significance: Proves that despite his age, Rayleigh can hold his own against one of the Navy's strongest fighters, demonstrating the power of the previous generation.

reveals.information: Can match Admiral Kizaru in combat despite his age

name.japanese: バーソロミュー・くま

keyMoments.title: The Real Kuma Appears
keyMoments.description: The real Bartholomew Kuma materializes on the battlefield and orders the Pacifista PX-1 to stand down.
keyMoments.significance: Kuma's appearance adds another layer of terror. The crew faces the original Warlord after barely surviving his Pacifista duplicates.

keyMoments.title: Asks Zoro About Vacation Destination
keyMoments.description: Kuma calmly asks Zoro the cryptic question about where he would like to go on vacation, the same question from Thriller Bark.
keyMoments.significance: This mysterious question has deep meaning that won't be revealed for many episodes, connecting to Kuma's true intentions and the Revolutionary Army.
keyMoments.quote: If you could go anywhere for a vacation, where would you like to go?

keyMoments.title: Makes Zoro Disappear
keyMoments.description: Kuma uses his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi power to make Zoro vanish completely, beginning the separation of the Straw Hat crew.
keyMoments.significance: This action starts one of the most significant story arcs in One Piece - the forced separation and two-year time skip. Kuma's true motives remain mysterious.

abilities.description: Kuma uses his paw-padded hands to repel people, sending them flying to distant locations. The victim appears to vanish in a bubble-like effect.

name.japanese: トニートニー・チョッパー

keyMoments.title: Transforms into Monster Point
keyMoments.description: Chopper consumes multiple Rumble Balls and transforms into his massive, uncontrollable Monster Point form in a desperate attempt to protect his crew.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the absolute desperation of the situation. Chopper only uses this dangerous form as a last resort, showing how hopeless their predicament has become.

keyMoments.title: Attempts to Execute Zoro
keyMoments.description: Kizaru prepares to kill the injured Zoro with a light kick, only stopped by Rayleigh's intervention.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Kizaru's ruthless efficiency and the Straw Hats' helplessness against Admiral power.

keyMoments.title: Battles Silvers Rayleigh
keyMoments.description: Kizaru engages the legendary pirate in combat, creating his Ama no Murakumo light sword and clashing with Rayleigh.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that even an Admiral must take the Dark King seriously, showcasing the power level of both fighters.
keyMoments.quote: I have come here under the instructions of the Celestial Dragons. I cannot simply leave.

abilities.description: Kizaru creates a sword made entirely of light to use in combat.
Kizaru uses reflected light to move at incredible speeds, attempting to chase the Straw Hats.

keyMoments.title: Attacks Luffy with Ashigara Dokoi
keyMoments.description: Sentomaru intercepts Luffy and uses his powerful Ashigara Dokoi palm thrust technique to send him flying, demonstrating his ability to damage Luffy despite his rubber body.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Sentomaru as a formidable fighter who can bypass Luffy's Devil Fruit defenses, foreshadowing Haki usage.

abilities.description: A devastating palm thrust technique that can damage even Luffy's rubber body, likely utilizing Haki.
